body:
https://ruqqus.com/+generai

Owner created a deliberate lookalike guild (`GeneraI` vs `general`) and began yanking content from the real +general. This misleads users. Although users can un-yank their content, deliberately misleading other users by impersonating the Ruqqus system is not okay.

All content has been returned to the real +general.
body_html:
https://ruqqus.com/+generai

Owner created a deliberate lookalike guild (GeneraI vs general) and began yanking content from the real +general. This misleads users. Although users can un-yank their content, deliberately misleading other users by impersonating the Ruqqus system is not okay.

All content has been returned to the real +general.
title: +GeneraI (uppercase i)- banned for impersonating +general

body:
Because yanking every post to a guild (that's impersonating *that* guild) is completely different to a username. I think a lot more people will understand that if my username is "realdonaldtrump", it's 99.999999% not *actually* Donald Trump.

But if I was to do:

- GeneraI

- Ge​neral

- Gener​a​I

- General

Which one is the real one? (Hint: they're all different)
body_html:
Because yanking every post to a guild (that's impersonating that guild) is completely different to a username. I think a lot more people will understand that if my username is "realdonaldtrump", it's 99.999999% not actually Donald Trump.

But if I was to do:

  • GeneraI

  • Ge​neral

  • Gener​a​I

  • General

Which one is the real one? (Hint: they're all different)

body:
Yes, if your name is "realdonaldtrump", most people will probably know it's a fake. However, if Ruqqus grows, it would not be unreasonable to expect to see important people having an account.
I personally don't think it is a good idea to allow people to impersonate others, but that's just me. However, if impersonating others is allowed, and the offered solution is a checkmark, then why not add it to the guilds too? It would work as well. Yahoo mail for example has a special checkmark for the official e-mails from Yahoo.
body_html: Yes, if your name is "realdonaldtrump", most people will probably know it's a fake. However, if Ruqqus grows, it would not be unreasonable to expect to see important people having an account. I personally don't think it is a good idea to allow people to impersonate others, but that's just me. However, if impersonating others is allowed, and the offered solution is a checkmark, then why not add it to the guilds too? It would work as well. Yahoo mail for example has a special checkmark for the official e-mails from Yahoo.

Which one is the real one? (Hint: they're all different)

body:
Would you suggest having the "Official" badge for official Ruqqus guilds? To me, that would be the only way it makes sense, because if you have multiple guilds under the one topic (not official guilds), how does one interrupt a verified badge? If there is +Mac that was made this year, and that gets a badge, in two years time when +macOS is created, does that invalidate +macOS because +Mac already has a badge?

Having badges for official/verified high-profile people and official Ruqqus guilds (+general, +RuqqusAdmin) makes sense, but as you may of suggested in your initial comment ("Why is it not OK to impersonate guilds then?"), that may be unnecessary and confusing for users.


Edit: ignore what I said about +Mac and +macOS (since they're already created), I was using it as an example haha
body_html:
Would you suggest having the "Official" badge for official Ruqqus guilds? To me, that would be the only way it makes sense, because if you have multiple guilds under the one topic (not official guilds), how does one interrupt a verified badge? If there is +Mac that was made this year, and that gets a badge, in two years time when +MacOS is created, does that invalidate +MacOS because +Mac already has a badge?

Having badges for official/verified high-profile people and official Ruqqus guilds (+general, +RuqqusAdmin) makes sense, but as you may of suggested in your initial comment ("Why is it not OK to impersonate guilds then?"), that may be unnecessary and confusing for users.

Edit: ignore what I said about +Mac and +MacOS (since they're already created), I was using it as an example haha

post.body:
https://ruqqus.com/+generai

Owner created a deliberate lookalike guild (`GeneraI` vs `general`) and began yanking content from the real +general. This misleads users. Although users can un-yank their content, deliberately misleading other users by impersonating the Ruqqus system is not okay.

All content has been returned to the real +general.
post.body_html:
https://ruqqus.com/+generai

Owner created a deliberate lookalike guild (GeneraI vs general) and began yanking content from the real +general. This misleads users. Although users can un-yank their content, deliberately misleading other users by impersonating the Ruqqus system is not okay.

All content has been returned to the real +general.
post.title: +GeneraI (uppercase i)- banned for impersonating +general
